sentences.english: Rome's military invasion of Great Britain, Scottish pipers introduced.
sentences.chinese: 罗马军队入侵大不列颠的时候，风笛传入苏格兰。

sentences.english: "I'll sell them to you, " said the piper.
sentences.chinese: “我可以卖给你呀，”风笛手说道。

sentences.english: The weather was unkind to those pipers who played in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 坏天气对上午那些风笛吹奏者毫不容情。

sentences.english: Yet Millin projected an outward bearing of complete composure and utter determination.
sentences.chinese: 然而米林镇静十足地向外伸出风笛并奏出果断的声音。

sentences.english: A lot can be said for pipers and tin whistlers.
sentences.chinese: 说到风笛和六孔笛，有很多讲究。

sentences.english: Bagpipers took part in the ceremony at the World Trade Center.
sentences.chinese: 参加世贸中心纪念仪式的风笛手。

sentences.english: Bagpipes and dancing open the competitions of local sporting events, which are called Highland Gatherings.
sentences.chinese: 高地风笛与利尔舞揭开了高地运动盛会的序幕。

sentences.english: In Scotland the military tattoo traditionally includes bagpipes and drums.
sentences.chinese: 在苏格兰军事表演传统地包括风笛和鼓。

sentences.english: There is something undeniably soulful about the eerie whine of the highland bagpipes.
sentences.chinese: 高原风笛神秘的哀鸣有着让人无法抗拒的深情。

sentences.english: The bagpipe is a sweet musical instrument.
sentences.chinese: 风笛是一种听起来很悦耳的乐器。

sentences.english: The regimental band triumphantly piped the soldiers in.
sentences.chinese: 团部的乐队用风笛奏起凯歌，迎入士兵。

sentences.english: A piper is always needed at Burns-suppers.
sentences.chinese: 风笛手最早经常在“彭斯之夜”上演奏。

sentences.english: I would fly to England to see the Tower of London and to hear the bagpipes.
sentences.chinese: 我要飞到英格兰去看伦敦塔和听风笛。

sentences.english: Hear the trumpets, hear the pipers.
The pipers calling you to join him.
sentences.chinese: 风笛打电话给你和他一起。

sentences.english: Mr. Vinegar took the bagpipes and the piper led the cow away.
sentences.chinese: 于是醋溜先生拿过了风笛，风笛手牵走了奶牛。
